explanation:
1) OS_ObjectIndexFromToken — This is the only function called by OS_ModuleLoad_Impl (per the static call graph). To prove OS_ModuleLoad_Impl does not (directly or indirectly) call itself you must inspect OS_ObjectIndexFromToken and any functions it calls to ensure there is no path back to OS_ModuleLoad_Impl.

2) OS_ModuleLoad — This is a known caller of OS_ModuleLoad_Impl (the higher-level wrapper). Including it is necessary to check for cycles that might involve wrapper/dispatcher functions (e.g., OS_ModuleLoad_Impl -> ... -> OS_ModuleLoad -> OS_ModuleLoad_Impl). Even if the immediate callee (OS_ObjectIndexFromToken) has no callees according to the graph, examining OS_ModuleLoad confirms there is no alternative path through callers that could form an indirect recursion.
